title: (x) Non-format font? / ultrafat filled-in Egyptienne - custom, similar to Frank, Pump {gang}
content:
Any ideas what this font is ? or anything similar ?

from [http://www.non-format.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141115000119/http:/www.non-format.com/ "http://www.non-format.com/")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141115000119im_/http:/typophile.com/files/NEW_FONT_4251.jpg)

thanks!

Leigh
author: Hibell

comments.content:
You might be able to achieve something similar with Clarendon and a broad stroke added, but I imagine this has undergone quite a bit of extra work.  
Tim

looking for something like this ?

[http://www.dafont.com/cowboys.font?nb\_ppp=50&classt=alpha&text=HYDRO](http://web.archive.org/web/20141115000119/http:/www.dafont.com/cowboys.font?nb_ppp=50&classt=alpha&text=HYDRO "http://www.dafont.com/cowboys.font?nb\_ppp=50&classt=alpha&text=HYDRO")

but not a crappy free font

cheers!

I think this is our good friend Giza 95 again, with a stroke added.

- Lex

This is indeed a heavily stroked Egyptienne. The only way to know for sure what it is would be to simulate it. Anybody owns a license for Giza?

On the other hand, if you want this effect all you need is a nice'n'chunky slab and start stroking the thing. ;^)

Voila, I have stroked the chunky slab.

Below, Giza 77 with a fat white stroke. It would take a bit of tweaking to get it to look exactly the way it does above, but I'd say this is definitely the typeface.

Skylar

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141115000119im_/http:/typophile.com/files/giza-stroke_5030.gif)

Nice one! i'll give it a go.

Thank you for your time!

Leigh

just though i'd let you know i came across this font today which is very close

[http://www.neutura.org/Frank.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20141115000119/http:/www.neutura.org/Frank.html "http://www.neutura.org/Frank.html")

Stumbled upon [Pump](http://web.archive.org/web/20141115000119/http:/www.houseofburvo.co.uk/pumpfont.html) from House of Burvo via [Typeneu](http://web.archive.org/web/20141115000119/http:/www.typeneu.com/norways-uredd-use-houseofburvo-fonts/). Pretty close, too.
